newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-WORLD CUP TICKET SALES REACH 900,000 IN SIX WEEKS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-WORLD CUP TICKET SALES REACH 900,000 IN SIX WEEKS.

text.p: Some 900,000 tickets for the 1998 World Cup soccer finals have been snapped up since they went on sale to the public six weeks ago, organisers said on Friday.
"It is extremely satisfactory and promising. It shows that the formula we chose was good," Jacques Lambert, general director of the organising commitee (CFO), told the sports daily l'Equipe.
French Soccer Federation licence holders took up 335,000 tickets and sponsors bought 170,000 more before the tickets went on sale to the public on November 27.

In all, 1.5 million tickets will be available in France. A further one million are going to soccer's world governing body FIFA and to tour operators for sale in the countries which qualify for the finals.
